Observation record, ER-44, will be completed with 15 minute checks.e.  security/designee will be located at the Fire/Exit door when visual observation (1:1) is ordered. Once the delayed egress hardware for this door is appropriately approved by Department of Health, the additional person sitting as this door will no longer be required.3.  Rounding will be conducted on behavioral health patients hourly by the charge nurse. The nurse assigned to Behavioral Health patients ordered 1:1 visual observation will notify charge nurse and document notification in the medical record under ED Adult Systems Assessment – Clinical Progress notes.  Hourly rounds will review the sitters' observation record to assure that the observation record is being completed, confirm proper environment and that patient is in paper scrubs. The charge nurse will utilize the ED-044B form to document the hourly rounding. Once the tracking board populates, the charge nurse will verify that the 1:1 order was executed. A Code walker drill will be conducted quarterly for one year beginning with the third quarter of 2023 to ensure staff are properly implementing elopement initiations.  De-briefing will occur after each drill to discuss the outcomes. The results of each drill will be reported to the Safety Excellence Steering Committee.  5.  Audits of 100% of behavioral health patients began on June 23, 2023 by the Director of Patient Services/designee. Audit findings will be presented to the Safety Excellence Steering Committee beginning September 2023. Minutes of the meeting will verify compliance. 6.  Non-compliance with action plan/policies will be followed up by the Director of Patient Services/designee following the Progressive Discipline Policy.7.
